page.title: 19HOME LIFE - SULLINGTON
page.content: Families in Sullington are mainly small with just one or two children. Pets are usually dogs and cats or exotic birds. Breakfast in the average home is a hurried meal of cereal or toast and a cup of tea. At lunch time children have a meal at school but dad has a packed lunch of sandwiches. All homes have a freezer but only about a quarter have a dishwasher and microwave oven. Generally food is cooked by solid fuel or electricity. The main evening meal consists of meat with two or three vegetables followed by various puddings or fresh fruit. Tea is the most popular beveridge drink. When entertaining at home wine is mostly served but "Bring a bottle" parties are more popular especially with teenagers.
